author: The Record
title: Roadrunners quarterback Hays throws 4 TDs
text: Roadrunners quarterback Hays throws 4 TDs Comment Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 12:01 AM By The Record Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 12:01 AM » Social News The Delta College football team outgained Butte College. In fact, the Mustangs either were even or led the Roadrunners in most statistical categories. But the only stat that really counts, the final score, was where Delta fell short. Tommy Hays threw four touchdowns, including two to Robert Combs, and Butte beat the Mustangs 34-19 on Saturday at Cowan Stadium in Butte Valley. Hays completed 14 of 24 passes for 201 yards and touchdowns of 17, 40, 27 and 26 yards. Lodi graduate Chance Trammell opened the scoring with a 5-yard run for the Roadrunners (2-3), who won their second game in a row after an 0-3 start. Trammell’s run culminated a 6-play, 41-yard drive. Trammell ran for 31 yards on 11 carries and one touchdown. The Mustangs struck quickly on their next two possessions. Running back Evan Owens put Delta (2-3) on the board with 26 seconds remaining in the first quarter with a 29-yard touchdown reception from Phillip Kimble on the first play of their drive. Joel Chavez’s extra point made it 7-6 in Delta’s favor. The Mustangs extended their lead early in the second quarter with a two-play, 69-yard drive that ended on a 64-yard Kimble pass to Alec Von Alvensleben. Chavez’s extra point attempt failed, but Delta led 13-6. Butte scored 21 unanswered points, beginning with a 17-yard touchdown from Hays to Combs with 35 seconds left in the first half. Early in the third quarter, Hays hit Steven Robinson for 40-yard touchdown, and the Roadrunners led again, 20-13. With 3:24 left in the third, Hays’ third TD pass of the game was a 27-yard strike to Demontra McNealy to make it 27-13. But Delta answered again quickly, when Owens ran 60 yards for a touchdown on the first play after McNealy’s touchdown to close within 27-19. Butte then marched 70 yards in seven plays, and Hays found Combs with a 26-yard pass to close the scoring. Kimble completed 26 of 44 passes for 303 yards with two touchdowns and one interception. Von Alvensleben had six receptions for 144 yards and one touchdown, and Owens ran for 127 yards on 18 carries and a touchdown. He also caught a touchdown. Christian Valeros had an interception, and Chris Sampino had 10 total tackles, including a sack, and Curtis Young had nine total tackles for Delta. The Mustangs have a bye this week, then will host Chabot at 1 p.m. on Oct. 17 at DeRicco Field. By The Record
